Detailed Description

============================================================================

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* CSL_SecProxyMemAccessCbFxnPtr) (uintptr_t addr, uint8_t *pData, uint32_t elemSizeBytes, uint32_t elemCnt)

Callback function used to write/read to/from memory.

This typedef defines a callback function that is used to write data into or read data from memory. In the write case, data is copied from pData to addr. In the read case, data is copied from addr to pData.

The parameters of this function are:

Parameters
addr[IN] Address of the proxy data memory (src addr for reads, dst addr for writes)
pData[IN] Pointer (virtual address) to data to be written to or read from
elemSizeBytes[IN] Size in bytes of each data element. This value is typically 1 (for byte accesses) or 4 (for 32-bit accesses).
elemCnt[IN] Number of elements to write/read. The total

of bytes written/read is (elemCnt *

elemSizeBytes).
